comment: Open note everything! Tests, quizzes and discussions. Sometimes the work load could feel like a lot, but it's overall pretty easy. He was super understanding and easily accessible. I had him for summer semester and I'd definitely take him again. Don't be scared by these reviews he's a good teacher.

It was one of my favorite classes I've ever taken. He makes sure you walk out of this class with a better understanding of the world and the people around you. I loved participating in class, it helped me better understand the material. You have a week to do the "take-home" test, and he isn't that hard of a grader if you know the material well.

He grades very tough and is very open about running for office once (he lost in a landslide). He is very caring and has office hours where I will give away answers on a test. Cusses alot... But he isn't all that bad. I suggest doing the test as he gives but make sure the way you word it is to his liking. And explain your answer in great detail.

Great professor for this class, lectures make you very invested in the topic. There are take home exams but you can find all the info on the lectures and go to his office hours for feedback before the due date, which will guarantee you an A or B. He really cares about his students, loved this class!

I took this class online. This class was a very easy workload. Everything is open notes and all I had to use was the powerpoints. He is very easy to reach and is flexible if you need any help. Everything is organized and easy to find. You do need to put in a bit of effort when answering exam questions, but he holds zooms so you can ask questions!

I took this class over summer. I had a hard personal time, but the class was a very simple workload. Everything is open notes. He is very easy to reach and will work with you and is flexible if you need any help. Everything is very organized and easy to find. I would definetly take him again!
Fantastic professor, he's always passionate about the material, engaged with his students, and somehow makes learning about government interesting.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Castater is great! This class is an easy A.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Incredible Professor. He makes his class SO easy to do well in. Not only does he provide a bunch of extra credit late in the semester, but he is available every week for office hours. If you show up during the week of an Exam, you will certainly pass if not get an A. He wants students to succeed and will explain one concept a thousand ways.

An amazing professor! Makes learning about international law and organizations very interesting. 25% of your grade comes from showing up to class and participating. So participate! The tests are take home tests and you can go to his office to get your test reviewed. DO IT! This will guarantee an A or a B in this class.

Very engaging lectures, easy to follow and understand the materials. No book required, the only grades are exam grades. They are take home exams and open-book, if you attend his office hours he will even go through your answers and tell you where to change or elaborate an answer to get credit. Overall, great professor.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I read the reviews prior and was nervous about taking him but I think this professor has lazy people grading him. He is one of the best lecture professors I've taken and makes class funny/interesting. He's an easy grader and as long as you email him before class he excuses you without an explanation. He has 5 open-note, take-home tests. Take him!

Amazing professor, if you see a bad rating those people didn't try. The class is graded on attendance + exams so just show up to the class. The exams are all take home and he allows you to use your resources. All of the answers are in his lectures. Go to his office hours and he'll tell you what's wrong and how to fix it. Best professor at KSU.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: If you take him get ready to work and claw your way for a good grade, very strict in grading even on opinion based answers.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: GO TO THE ZOOM MEETINGS. If you reach out to him and go to the office hours you will get an A because he basically gives away the answer but if you dont go youll fail every exam. Its really a simple class you just have to stay on top of modules and posts.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Participation matters

comment: Anyone who got a bad grade in this class didn't try hard enough. His exams are all take-home and short answer. Yes the questions can be difficult, but he is extremely helpful if you are confused. He holds a zoom meeting before each exam, and he will practically give away the answer, as long as he sees you are trying and learning.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This professor is the worst if I could rate him in the negatives I would. He only accepts one point of view.... his. Once I skewed my assignments to match his views suddenly I got amazing grades. I even blatantly said that his view was right and the other side was wrong, I got an A on that assignment. He's so nit picky and just awful.
Graded way too hard! You can only pass his class if you go to his office!

i would not recommend taking this professor online.. he grades very hard & if you miss one thing in the question he marks all 10 points off on the exam. the fact that he grades very hard, but doesnt give extra credit is pretty much setting us up for failure. in this class it is VERY hard to keep a good grade because of how harsh he grades.

Super considerate professor. If you need help with any assignments, if you go to his office he'll take the time to go over EVERYTHING with you. He really cares about his students and has great energy. Not an easy class but he is a great guy and I would recommend because this is one of the rare few times that I remembered all the material taught.

Dont take unless youre confident about your writing skills. He is a very picky test grader and even if you miss a small detail you will get your grade botched. Plenty of people did fine in this class but I did not happen to be one of them. He either likes your writing style or hates it. No extra credit and no late work.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Let me just say that this guy is the biggest jerk ever. He is such a tough grader. The tests were all essay questions and if you word something in a way he doesn't like he takes off points. I answered all the questions and parts of the questions and got grades in the 50s & 60s. I think he just grades though just to be mean. Don't take him!

Ridiculously tough grader. I answered his test questions straight from his lectures and got grades ranging from 40-75. Counts off for the slightest things, even if he didnt like the wording of a correct answer. The weekly modules and discussion posts help a little to make up those grades, but Ive never been so stressed over a grade in my life.

He's the toughest grader I've ever had. I would spend hours working on an assignment and still get a poor grade on the assignment. I debated dropping his class for weeks because the highest grade I was receiving was a 70. Do not take this class if you are not willing to work on assignments for a couple more hours than your other classes.

He is not an easy grader. He nitpicks all of his assignments, if your answer isnt exactly how he thinks it should be then he marks it wrong. His lectures are long and drawn out. If you arent one of his favorites then you have no chance of passing his class. The test and current event assignments are all short answer, no multiple choose.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He's a cool, funny guy. His assignments and exams, however, are based around ways of thinking. If you can't think exactly like him and answer the questions exactly as he would, get ready to fail.

He was extremely nit-picky when grading tests and current event assignments. I would take exactly what he said from his lectures and use it on my test, but would still manage to either fail or get a C on the tests. I would not recommend.

He gives hard 10 question tests every week for short response answers, and counts of points for every little thing. Also, you have to devote a LOT of time into those tests & his current events. I'm a straight A student and got 50's on his exams practically every other week. Makes everything due Friday instead of Sunday. Makes a req. easy class hard
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: I took his class online and it was an awful decision. If he doesn't like one little detail on your paper, he will take off 20 points. He is stubborn and makes the class way harder than it actually is.

Eric is a very funny guy, so I never dreaded going to his class because I enjoyed listening to his lectures. The exams and current events are done out of class but the majority of the answers can be found in the powerpoints he posts, or go to his office and he will tell you the answer. Go to class, give good effort on the work, speak like twiceA.

I slept through most every class, if I showed up, and passed with ease. He makes you work for the grades on the individual assignments, and his grading criteria is SUPER WEIRD, but he is very accessible and will help you out a lot. He is super passionate and very energetic, not to mention really funny, and he knows what he is talking about.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I don't understand how you could fall asleep in Eric's class. He is hilarious and extremely energetic. Participation and attendance is 25% of the grade, which is honestly a blessing. Everything is take-home, and while he is a tough grader, you can literally ask him anything about the exams and assignments during his office hours.

Always available, and cares about his students. I would take another class of his if possible. Tough grader, but allows you to literally get the answers from him in his office if need be, so very accessible.

His class was structured where per every unit (5) you had a current event assignment and an exam. You had a week to take home and complete each one and could work with your peers and use notes. If you went to his office hours to have him review it, you were more likely to get a good grade. Willing to help your grade if you show up and try.
